Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: BACKGROUND : S - 53482 and S - 23121 are N - phenylimide herbicides and produced embryolethality , teratogenicity ( mainly ventricular septal defects and wavy ribs ) , and growth retardation in rats in conventional oral developmental toxicity studies .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| embryolethality |
| teratogenicity |
| ventricular septal defects |
| growth retardation. |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| embryolethality |
| teratogenicity |
| ventricular septal defects |
| growth retardation |

Note: In the original paragraph, "embryolethality" refers to the death of embryos or fetuses, which is a disease or condition. "Teratogenicity" refers to the ability of an agent to cause birth defects, which are diseases or conditions. "Ventricular septal defects" and "growth retardation" are specific types of diseases or conditions. Therefore, all of these entities are valid "Disease" entities.
